summary: Email correspondence between an Assistant United States Attorney and FBI personnel regarding investigative follow-ups in the Epstein/Maxwell case. The email discusses scheduling an interview in Austin, reviewing seized photos, analyzing flight records for Ghislaine Maxwell and others, checking victim notification system status, and coordinating a meeting with defense attorneys.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of flight record analysis; the email requests a summary analysis of her flights and any overlap with another individual.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced regarding flight records for his private jet and manifests from a previous case.

connections.description: Implied connection through the investigation's focus on analyzing their flight records for overlap, and Maxwell's association with Epstein's case.

events.title: Scheduled interview in Austin
events.description: A meeting is confirmed for 9:30 AM in Austin with an individual (name redacted) as part of the investigation.

events.title: Meeting with defense attorneys
events.description: A meeting with defense attorneys is scheduled for 10 AM, and the AUSA is invited to join.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Investigators are seeking to analyze flight records for Ghislaine Maxwell and another individual to identify any overlap, noting these records are for international flights only.
The investigation involves reviewing photos seized during search warrants to check for dates on them.
Prosecutors are coordinating with the FBI on multiple investigative steps, including witness interviews and evidence review, indicating an active phase of the case.
The correspondence confirms the use of the Victim Notification System (VNS) for multiple individuals involved in the case.
The email references obtaining emails from a third party (initials 'E') who agreed to provide them.
